alert.note: Alert for Cimarron; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 08 at 5:11PM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions are occurring. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...The western two thirds of the Oklahoma Panhandle and the northwestern and far western Texas Panhandle. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Whiteout conditions are expected and will make travel treacherous and potentially life-threatening. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Do not travel. A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Do not travel. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds are likely. Do not travel. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely dangerous. Do not travel. If you absolutely must travel due to an emergency situation, have a winter survival kit with you and notify a friend or family of your plans. Do not travel. If you get stranded, stay in your vehicle. Do not travel.
